snippet: In an unusually provocative move, the young sheikha who runs Qatar’s museums authority has unveiled 14 giant sculptures by Damien Hirst, charting an infant’s development in the womb.
abstract: Qatar unveils 14 giant sculptures by Damien Hirst, entitled The Miraculous Journey, which chronicle gestation of fetus and end with 46-foot-tall anatomically correct baby boy; sculptures, commissioned by Sheikha al Mayassa Hamad bin Khalifa al-Thani, chairwoman of Qatar Museums Authority, are considered an unusually provocative installation for an Islamic nation.
lead_paragraph: In an unusually provocative move, the young sheikha who runs Qatar’s museums authority has unveiled 14 giant sculptures by Damien Hirst, charting an infant’s development in the womb.

headline.seo: Damien Hirst’s Anatomical Sculptures Have Their Debut
headline.main: Art, From Conception to Birth in Qatar
headline.print_headline: Art, From Conception to Birth in Qatar
